Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking at Case 101: The first event is March 1st at 8:00, and the last is March 1st at 10:15. Let me calculate the difference. From 8:00 to 10:15 is 2 hours and 15 minutes. Converting that to minutes: 2*60 +15 = 135 minutes, which is 2.25 hours.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 102: First event is 8:05, last is March 2nd 9:15. From March 1 8:05 to March 2 8:05 is 24 hours, then add the remaining 1 hour and 10 minutes. So total is 24h + 1h10m = 25h10m.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 103: The first event is March 1st 8:10, last is March 1st 9:30. So thats 1 hour 20 minutes.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Case 104: First event March 1st 8:20, last March 2nd 8:30. Let me calculate properly. The start is March 1 8:20, end March 2 8:30. The duration is 24 hours and 10 minutes.

Name: Backtracking - NE
Text: Case 105: The first event is March 1 8:25, last is March 3 9:30. From March 1 8:25 to March 2 8:25 is 24 hours. Then from March 2 8:25 to March 3 9:30 is 1 hour 5 minutes. Total is 24h + 1h5m = 25h5m.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: List all durations in minutes: Case 101: 135, Case 102: 1510, Case 103: 80, Case 104: 1450, Case 105: 1505. Total sum 4680 minutes, average 936 minutes.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - NE
Text: Compute variance and standard deviation using the durations. Standard deviation is ~677 minutes.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The cases with significantly longer times are cases 102, 105, and 104 since they are much longer than 101 and 103.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For case 102: long wait between assignment and escalation, then between escalation and investigation, and huge gap between investigation on March 1 14:00 and resolve on March 2 9:00.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For case 104: after investigation on March 1 13:00, next event resolve on March 2 8:00, 13 hours gap.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For case 105: escalation, then gap between first investigate March 1 9:10 and second investigate March 2 14:00, then 12 hours to resolve on March 3.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Patterns: Escalations in 102 and 105, long gaps between activities especially after investigation in all three cases.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Possible root causes: Inefficient Handoff Between Teams, Agent Availability or Workload, System or Process Gaps.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Applying these to the specific cases: Case 104s gap due to agent unavailable, Case 102s gap after escalation, Case 105s multiple gaps.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Proposed Insights and Recommendations: Improve Escalation Handling, Monitor for Stale Tickets, Agent Workload Management.
